forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 52. West wind around 3 mph.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly sunny. High near 65, with temperatures falling to around 61 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 3 to 8 mph.

weather_report:
As the clock ticks toward evening in Downtown San Francisco, the city finds itself cloaked in a gentle veil of cloud, the air still and cool. The forecast predicts a low around 52, which should invite a soft sweater or a light jacket. The dimming light reveals a world where high buildings emerge like sentinels from the mist, the far-off Golden Gate Bridge standing as a delicate brushstroke against the watercolor sky. A whisper of a west wind stirs lazily, hardly enough to disturb the calm.

Tomorrow promises partly sunny skies, with a high near 65, though the chill will linger in the shadows as the day settles into a soft embrace of warmth. The clarity is decent, but the marine layer will hold sway in some pockets, creating a sultry bath of moisture. Even now, one might be tempted to stroll along the Embarcadero or find a cozy café with a view, allowing the evening to unfurl softly, spurred on by the anticipation of a pleasant day to come. An evening walk by the water, where the soft glow of streetlamps winks down at the waves, would be an exquisite choice, allowing the cool air to reflect on the calm waters alongside the distant hum of the city.
